data.title: Video installer
data.body: Similar to what we did with music in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/5304. The CD rip mechanism needs to make sure it handles the soviet/allies and GDI/Nod CD variants in a "please insert disc 2 now" manner. There is documentation at https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Game-Content#installing-the-full-motion-videos but the average gamer doesn't read it and complains that "great game, but FMV's don't work yet".

data.title: Fixed map "Tread Lightly"
data.body:
http://ra2maps.zzattack.org/Tiberian%20Sun/index.php?dir=Official%20Multiplayer%2FTread%20Lightly reimported with the fixed up version at https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/10368.

Closes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/9603 and adds light spots as well as crates.

data.title: Added the isometric legacy map importer
data.body:
This is a rebased and slightly improved version of the one published by @pchote. It adds argument validation, fixed the file not found errors, uncommented decorational actors in the translation table and made sure it will also work with Red Alert 2 maps. I am submitting this now, because it is quite hard to maintain outside this repository.

Closes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/9335.

data.title: New game modes
data.body:
I think we should have some more game modes besides the old 'destroy everything` Conquest mode and KotH.

First and foremost, I think all our game modes should support a time limit. The timer in the sidebar would then run backwards when a limit is set, forwards if not. I think this could be interesting for tournaments. When the time runs out before there's a winner, both players lose, resulting in a draw.

As an idea for a new game mode, I think a 'Destruction` mode where the value of killed units is counted towards a player's score could be interesting. Players would need to think about whether they want to employ expensive powerful units, or weaker but cheaper ones. This game mode would need a score limit, changeable in the lobby.

Another idea would be an 'Economy' mode where the most harvested ore (or probably oil derricks would work out fairer) contributes to the score.

Maps would then define the game types they support in their `Type` attribute, which would then be an array instead of a single string as it is now.

There are two problems I don't have a solution for yet with that scheme:
1. How would the lobby en- or disable the appropriate `*VictoryConditions` trait?
2. The lobby would need to change according to which game mode is selected for a map (eg. show a time and score limit field). It could also probably explain the rules in a text field somewhere. It currently doesn't know anything about these things at all.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/29519494-new-game-modes?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: Eliminated superfluous linendings
data.body: Eliminated linendings from player files

data.title: Misc Missile and CreateEffectWarhead tweaks
data.body:
- Fixes #10350 by using `airMargin` in CEWH water check
- unhardcodes `Missile` freefall gravity
- Make `CreateEffectWarhead` check for `HitShape.DistanceFromEdge` instead of `.OuterRadius` (to match `SpreadDamageWarhead`)

data.title: ZenHub integration
data.body:
> Hola! @Mailaender has created a [ZenHub](http://www.zenhub.io) account for the **OpenRA** organization. ZenHub is the leading team collaboration and project management solution built for GitHub.

---

> #### How do I use ZenHub?
> 
> To get set up with ZenHub, all you have to do is **[download the browser extension](https://www.zenhub.io?utm_source=ZHOnboarding)** and log in with your GitHub account. Once you do, you’ll get access to ZenHub’s complete feature-set immediately.
> #### What can ZenHub do?
> 
> ZenHub adds a series of enhancements directly inside the GitHub UI:
> - Real-time, customizable task boards for GitHub issues;
> - Burndown charts, estimates, and velocity tracking based on GitHub Milestones;
> - Personal to-do lists and task prioritization;
> - “+1” button for GitHub issues and comments;
> - Drag-and-drop file sharing;
> - Time-saving shortcuts like a quick repo switcher.
> ### [Add ZenHub to GitHub](https://www.zenhub.io?utm_source=ZHOnboarding)
> 
> _Still curious? See [more ZenHub features](https://www.zenhub.io/features?utm_source=ZHOnboarding) or read [user reviews](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/zenhub-for-github/ogcgkffhplmphkaahpmffcafajaocjbd/reviews). This issue was written by your friendly ZenHub bot, posted by request from @Mailaender._
> 
> ![ZenHub Board](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8771909/11153956/233ac4a8-89f1-11e5-94b1-1569d3f38b4d.png)

Shall we try this out? https://www.zenhub.io/open-source is free for us. We just need to place a badge to advertise them.

data.title: Suggestion : Restarting GPS Satellite when destroyed
data.body:
Hi :) 
Related to #9962 (Suggestion: Hide GPS icons when player has low power)

IIRC I think GPS is the only ability which doesn't get restarted after being destroyed and rebuilt, unlike other special abilities / superweapons. 

Maybe restarting the whole 10 min is too much ... but actually same happens with an Abomb if gets destroyed  :)

Maybe a reset for a few mins (5 min ?) could be a middle ground ? 

Thoughts ? :)

data.title: Experience added to Player Actor, Statistics
Idea - Radio orders/commands in multiplayer
data.body:
Hi :)

I know this is a more FPS-oriented feature ... but nevertheless I think that radio orders could be very useful in multiplayer games. 
I often lose time and concentration while writing to my teammates ^_^. Also, beacons would become more meaningful. And last but not least, writing blocks any other action (stop, attack move, ...)

For instance, we could have a key for opening radio-commands, then using numbers keys to issue an order (priority over selecting groups of units).

So it could be standard orders, or even custom-written orders (in a .yaml file ??? )

(Some possible examples of standard orders : 
Tactical orders : 
    Go 
    Follow Me 
        Cover Me 
    Take This Position 
    Hold This Position 

Tactical reports :
    Enemy Destroyed
    Sector Clear
    I'm in Position
    I'm flanking

Alert :  
    Fall Back 
    Need Assistance
    Report In 
    Enemy Flanking 
    Spy Spotted 
    Tanya Spotted 
    Demo truck Spotted  

Radio Responses :
    Affirmative
    Negative)

data.title: Fake structures revealed by spies
data.body:
Hello everyone :) 

I just tested out (release 151224) : spies can't infiltrate fake structures (WF, Radar, Navy), so they can easily identify them.

I think ScottNZ talked about it here : https://www.bountysource.com/issues/7983378-add-more-fake-buildings

I think it would make the french faction even more interesting if Fake buildings could be infiltrable, without giving the veterancy (or reveal for Radar) as supposed . 

Is this behaviour planned for future releases ? 

Thank you all ! :)

data.title: Remove some old 1v1 maps from the RA mod
data.body:
With the recent addition of three community maps, I felt these maps are played so little and would require such an overhaul that the original feeling of the maps would be lost.

Instead I feel we should remove them and wait for more competitive maps from the community (esp some naval 1v1 maps) and include them instead when the time comes.

data.title: Added a resize map command
data.body:
I found some unused code we had for the WinForms editor. https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/8511

In practice it is a bit of a dangerous operation which can result in data loss if you don't know what you are doing so I decided to not add a GUI for it, but keep it as a command line tool for now. Successfully used at https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/10301#issuecomment-168154367.

data.title: Speed up GlobalLightingPaletteEffect.
data.body:
Perform everything in integer arithmetic using some bit twiddling to avoid the performance cost of converting to and from floating point values.

On the TS shellmap, reduces CPU time spent in `GlobalLightingPaletteEffect.AdjustPalette` from 9.66% to 1.16%.

data.title: Missiles no longer trigger splash reliably when hitting water
data.body: Observed on RA destroyer and rocket soldier when shooting at empty water. More often than not, an explosion is shown instead.

data.title: Footprint HitShape
data.body:
For buildings in isometric perspective:

> [22:53:09]    pchote reaperrr: footprint is the way to go in any case
> [22:53:36]  pchote not hard to add
> [22:53:44]  pchote its just the superposition of a bunch of rectangles
> [22:53:51]  pchote the outer radius is the radius of the bounding rect
> [22:54:01]  pchote the falloff distance is the minimum distance from each of the rects
> [22:54:27]  pchote then divide it into N rects based on rows
> [22:54:33]  pchote merging adjacent rows of the same size 
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/29494057-add-footprint-hitshape?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).

data.title: Rebalance keep-off-the-grass-2.oramap for the RA mod
data.body:
In relation to #10298

map on resource centre http://resource.openra.net/maps/8264/ (parsed on bleed...)

Original
![k1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3636652/12058032/69b9ed1e-af3f-11e5-962d-0f85f2db0f77.jpg)

Updated
![k2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3636652/12058038/70ea0c68-af3f-11e5-8b61-6511ce5bfd24.jpg)

-Ore patches in spawns and expansions have been adjusted to remove the northern REF disadvantage.
-Ore mines at corner expansions have been reduced from three to two; terrain made less chokey
-Both ore mines in gem patch have been replaced by a single gem mine
-Trees, debris and detailing

data.title: Dispose fixes + misc touchups
data.body:
- Fix some Dispose implementations, and add some missing calls to Dispose.
- Fix serialization of custom exceptions.
- Rethrow exceptions correctly.

data.title: Suppress warning about Is.StringContaining on NUnit 3
data.body: A side effect of moving to NUnit 3, I believe.

data.title: Allow only valid file types when saving maps in the editor
data.body:
It will also allow saving to files and directories which have a dot in their name, which was the ultimate cause for the crash in #10339.

Fixes #10339.

data.title: resource center - display more maps on 'highest rated', 'most viewed', etc
data.body:
Sorry, cant figure out how to place this issue properly.

In the resource center there are buttons to select the highest rated map, the most viewed map, etc. When this is clicked it shows only the top result. It would be great if it would show a full page (or even more?) of sorted maps for the selected characteristic.

/edit: noobmapmaker  wants to merge 668 commits into master from bleed????
Ok, maybe I shouldnt have add a pull request... just an issue. Sorry new to github. I also cant delete this?

data.title: Delayed unit order execution
data.body: There's a delay between giving a unit an order and the order being executed. Even in singleplayer games. Why is that?
